message: It's always difficult to contact people at PyCon for short-notice reasons. Does anyone have any favorite tricks for keeping in touch with people they often see only once a year?
Stalk them! Google latitude, foursquare, facebook checkins, etc!  :P
PyCon twitter and irc? I haven't had much luck with this in the past either though
@coderanger, if it's old fashioned, does one need to find a rotary phone?
@mattg no - just write a rotary pulse simulator :)
Please don't touch me at pycon.
I hear tale of qr codes for contact info on badges at another conf.  That would be way cool...
@coderanger That would assume I had a number for the person?
@holdenweb This is why I bring a stack of business cards with me :-)
@holdenweb I could wear a purple fedora
My primary problem is that I am meeting people and I don't really know what they look like
We will have a peg board next to Registration for those inclined to communicate that way.

there should be an app somewhere in the pycon.org domain that'll let registered attendees upload a recent picture of themselves along with their irc, convore, and twitter handles. Then people could look up anyone at the conference and see what they look like.
it could be called "Have You Seen...?"
@jonesy If only there was some kind of book for all those faces ;-)
